website_summaries.verdict: The Excursion TR 10 is a burly, durable, and comfortable trail fiend that can handle moderately difficult terrains. It has exceptional comfort, good traction, and surprisingly runs lighter than how it looks or what the numbers indicate on the scale. The very affordable price, superb protection, and no-fuss functionality should make this shoe a worthy candidate for any trail enthusiast.
pros: Comfort is a prime asset of the 10th instalment of the Excursion TR, based on most reviews
The shoe is quite light despite the numbers on the weighing scale, according to several runners
A handful of users noted its excellent breathability
A good number of the reviews mentioned the shoe’s exceptional durability
The cushioning absorbs shock very well, according to some runners
The upper does a very good job of keeping dirt out, as noted in a couple of reviews
As observed by more than a few runners, the traction is very good
A small number of people who are up on their feet most of the day, valued the cushioning of the Saucony Excursion TR 10
This is an all-exercise shoe, as claimed by a handful of users
cons: The Excursion TR 10 is quite stiff
The break-in period is considerable, as stated by several
It looks too cumbersome or heavy for a few
A moderate number of runners felt that the fit is tighter and smaller than the past versions of this shoe
There is absolutely no ground feedback from this shoe, according to several reviewers
The heavily-padded ankle collar, tongue, and midsole prevent the shoe from drying quickly

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable shoes. I am a big guy (300lbs) with ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable shoes. I am a big guy (300lbs) with plantar fasciitis and I'm on my feet all day making deliveries. Every shoe that I've tried, and there have been many, I've had to add some type extra cushioning or hard plastic insert or both just to make the pain manageable. I haven't added anything to these shoes and my feet feel much better. I have ordered two more pair and I will only wear this line of shoes from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Already Falling Apart After Just 20 Miles Of Hiking
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fits ok. It does run slightly large. But after just 20 miles of hiking, the toe cover is already peeling back. I have used Saucony shoes for many years and this has never happened before. A few more miles and I am sure they will completely fall apart. I am very disappointed in these shoes. I expected much better quality from Saucony. As a follow up to my initial post, I had two horrible wipe outs with these shoes. I have hiked hundreds of miles without an accident before I started wearing these shoes. I think the sole is too rigid and becomes very slick when wet. I have since thrown these shoes away.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H. Neill

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I run in Saucony Rides and these feel the same but with a trail tread. Very nice. EDIT: I am STILL using this same pair. That includes training for and completing a Ragnar trail race late in 2017. Amazing longevity, even on the hard rock hiking here in AZ. EDIT 2: It is now April 29, 2018 (almost exactly a year since my review) and I am STILL using his shoe. Yes, it LOOKS like it has been used a year on dusty trails, but it has held up GREAT. Even the tread is still grippy... GREAT shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Mildewman

customer_reviews.title: These are a very comfortable shoe, though I will need different insoles in ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical when I first bought these because I thought the material felt cheaper compared to older models, but it is not. It is actually just a bit lighter with same quality you'd expect from Saucony. They are not water proof as some people have mentioned, so don't expect to trudge through pools unaffected. These are a very comfortable shoe, though I will need different insoles in the future. I've had these for about 4months now.
customer_reviews.author: steveronibamboni

customer_reviews.title: Not gore-tex!
customer_reviews.text: Returned. There's nothing wrong with the shoe, and it is actually pretty comfortable, but the description says gore-tex and this is not the gore-tex model.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: No support; tough on knees.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Saucony trail shoes for trail funning for over thirty years. This pair was a big disappointment. The toe box is roomy which is great, and the tread is good. Immediately on walking on them, I was concerned about the lack of support or cushioning. My fears were realized as started running through the woods. I stepped on a small fallen branch and felt it on my foot as if I had no shoe on. There seemed to be no cushioning, and my knees were hurting at the end of my run, which never happens and which I don't ever want to happen. I won't use these again. I hope I can return them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: True to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I like the large toe box generally found in Saucony brand shoes and these are consistent with my experience. I don’t run, but have been on several six mile walks with no issues. I’m very pleased with these. BTW, these are replacing a pair of Soucony’s I bought in ‘05 that are still holding up through much use, though the cushioning is long gone. The new shoes’ cushion in the sole and around the foot is a delight.
customer_reviews.author: James East

customer_reviews.title: Good but squeaky.
customer_reviews.text: Feels, fits and looks great but they squeak when you walk. This is my second pair and they both squeaked. I replaced the first because the mesh material is not as durable as different material from Saucony or other shoe makers. I had holes worn in the mesh on both sides in the mesh in that area between the logo and the solid strip of material leading to the toe box. I'm hoping it's an anomaly but not sure...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Trail Toughness
customer_reviews.text: I run a lot in the Saucony Peregrine but when I am on rocky trails the TR10 provides the protection I need without giving up comfort. Never found a road shoe as good as the discontinued Jazz but between the Peregrine and the Excursion TR10 Saucony has the trails covered!
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Running Trail Shoe for People who want Durability and Breathe-ability
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could run in really hot weather on very rocky terrain. I had no expectation that these would hold up very long. I beat these bad boys up regularly and the sole shows almost no signs of wear and tear. I still use them for trails 2 years later. They're definitely not my lightest running shoes, but those probably wouldn't have lasted a week on the trails I was running.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Yes mine were Gore Tex. Black and yellow color
customer_reviews.text: Fit very good, true to size for me. Light weight and seem to be made well. I ordered the black and yellow, and yes they are Gore Tex. I wore them for several days and like them well enough that I ordered another pair today. They are about twenty dollars more then the other colors that are not Gore Tex.
customer_reviews.author: Avak

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if they are fake saucony’s or just a bad batch but both shoe’s are falling apart after 2 months on the soles. I had the same pair but different color that lasted a year and never fell apart like these ones. Of course it’s past the warranty so now I need to buy a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G

customer_reviews.title: Love Saucony
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony shoes are great! They fit well and are comfortable. I am going hiking in them next week and have been walking on the treadmill with them since I got them a week ago. They support my feet well and think they will be great hiking, too.
customer_reviews.author: brenda.a.

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe...it's the third pair I've ordered. My only concern is that with this latest order the pair I received seem to have been worn before. By worn I mean tried on and then put back in the box, not "used." In general I expect my orders from Amazon to be filled with merchandise that is in unopened boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoes that don't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are understated and have good traction. They could maybe have a little more cushion, though. But if you like a shoe with a decent mix of comfort and tactile feel for the surface you're on, this might be for you.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking shoes that fit right
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable lightweight shoes, fitting very much as I had hoped. Can't say how they do for serious running as this area is being hit with rain and more rain, and I am definitely a fair weather runner. My experience with Saucony shoes has been very good, so I expect the same with these.
customer_reviews.author: Pomaikai

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe - Survived a 2-Day Outlet Mall Hike
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for some light trail hiking in the Smokey Mountains. They fit well and held up nicely to a two day hiking excursion - of following my wife around outlet malls. Hopefully I can put some real trail miles on these before the summer is out and I will update if I have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Chaney

customer_reviews.title: The old pair still looks good but were too broken in and so this pair ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have purchased, the first was at a box store that does not carry this model anymore. Use is mostly around the house and occasional running (10 miles per week) and they lasted about 1 year. The old pair still looks good but were too broken in and so this pair was purchased. Great shoe
customer_reviews.author: PeteReviews

customer_reviews.title: He is flat footed and these are so comfortable. They seem to be pretty durable and hold ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. He is flat footed and these are so comfortable. They seem to be pretty durable and hold up well in the rain. He can wear these all day and has no issues with his feet or back hurting. They are by far his favorite shoes.
customer_reviews.author: MKM

customer_reviews.title: These worked as the "second pair" for my nephew - ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked as the "second pair" for my nephew - he wanted them to be the "dress shoe" for his wardrobe. Teen boys, who knew. LOL They held up well and he continues to wear them even through the summer months after a full school year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Semon

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: These are quite possible the most comfortable pair of shoes I've ever owned. I'd take the pepsi challenge with these over any $100-200 pair any day!
customer_reviews.author: clallseven

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but not the inserts.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 pairs of these, as always, inserts always thin and cheap, replaced with sof sol athletic inserts, became perfect trail walking shoes. Great grip bottom. Seems each year, materials put into them is cut cost for company but not great for customers. Personally would recommend only if inserts were better.
customer_reviews.author: EagleClawster

customer_reviews.title: Good Supportive Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a good supportive shoe. The shoe runs about true to size. I selected a size 1/2 larger then I normally wear,and it's just right. Has great arch support for my heavyweight. The shoe is amazingly light. Overall it is a decent shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Look pretty good. The fit is right on
customer_reviews.text: Look pretty good. The fit is right on, as previous Saucony's have been. But the offset is less than I expected, which makes running tough for me. Weird leg dimensions I suppose, but these put alot of strain on my lower calf/achilles area. Also, kind of a firm ride with these shoes. For the 50 bucks I paid, they are worth keeping for long urban and trail walks. But I'll keep looking for a better trail runner.
customer_reviews.author: Ddd Ccc

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit as Usual
customer_reviews.text: The best running shoe in the world. Fits like a glove and very comfortable as always. I've been wearing Saucony for forty years, and always well made and very durable. Buy a pair today you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P. Damiano

customer_reviews.title: Light, waterproof, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waterproof shoe for my outdoor runs and something with a stiff sole and good tread because I run on some very uneven surfaces (although not muddy trails). So far these shoes have been terrific, even right out of the box. They are going to become my new go-to travel shoe, as well. I only do 3-4 mile runs, and so far hikes maybe twice that, so if you're a really long distance person, your milage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have several different pairs of Saucony shoes and would normally rate them much higher. However, the tr10 seems to lack the support you would expect from Saucony shoes. Also, the laces are a bit short.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gioia

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes for the Money.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes for the price. Neutral heel strike and traction for off road hiking / walking. Not particularly sturdy as a dedicated trail running shoe. Saucony makes (made?) a slightly lighter, cheaper model, with orange trim. I had a pair of those also. These are worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: kholmes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trails
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, good grip on rocks. Provides good cushion. Typical 4 mile hikes feels nothing on feet. Unlike sneakers bottom of my feed do not hurt, the rocks not pushing through the sole. Haven’t tried in water, don’t know how water proof they are.
customer_reviews.author: Veer

customer_reviews.title: Great trail runners
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trail runners. It took a couple dozen miles to get them soft enough, but after that they've been serving me really well on the rocky and dusty trails of the SF Bay. About 200 miles in they're beginning to show some signs of wear & tear, but will probably last me another couple hundred.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck!
customer_reviews.text: Vary durable so far. 2 months in. I work home remodeling so lots of bending squatting scuffing ext ext... Also have toe truble that hurts most of the time. With these shoes hardly even bothers me till I take them off. Note that I have also been using drsholls inserts. Only 4 🌟 because size was off 1/2 too small...had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer, Nathan

customer_reviews.title: New shoes, not quite new.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these shoes through Amazon for a while now. This pair, listed as new, can in clearly worn (bottoms show signs of wear). There was no typical packaging in and around the shoes. I like the shoes, but to spend what I spent on these shoes for almost new shoes, not what I have come to expect.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: They are not wide.  check the charts.
customer_reviews.text: They seem like nice shoes, but the size is not want I expected. I ordered 11m. But it wasn't wide. They were too tight for me on the sides. Make sure when ordering shoes they are wide or 11e.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly basic running shoe - I use them for trail running. I've bought them twice now. The first pair held up for the entire season (and I really beat them up ... creek crossings, mud, etc). They really seem reliable. I bought them again for this year because they held up so well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: One with black/yellow color comes with gore-tex feature
customer_reviews.text: I read that it is not goretex waterproof but saw one reply on reviews that the one with yellow color and goretex mark is waterproof.I bought it and used it today walking under continous rain for almost an hour and no water has entered the shoe.But I wouldnt use it in floody streets since it is not boots
customer_reviews.author: Primetimelime

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I only buy Sauconys because the first pair I bought was so damn comfortable. I wear them everywhere from casual outings to trails in the Shenandoah. Inserts would make these over the top in comfort. I find that these do run a bit small. I wear a 10.5 D and I had to get these in an 11 which is perfect for me. Do more research on their material because the decription is off. They do not contain Gore Tex.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boone

customer_reviews.title: They wear well and true to size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandson. I wear Saucony but he had never. He loved them from the first time he tried them on. The color was great grey, black and red . He really liked the color. He wears a men’s size 12 and he’s 14. Oh yes and they were very affordable !!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Rayfield

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Right out of the box with no break in they are great for walking around in. I'm on my feet all day and have fallen arches and they feel good. They are light and airy, and in my opinion they look cool. My son saw them and insisted on getting a pair too.
customer_reviews.author: James Remington

customer_reviews.title: Didnt fit!
customer_reviews.text: Didnt fit like my other pair, same shoe just different color..had to size up..
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: I keep coming back for more.
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason why this is my 4th pair!! I found a sneaker that fits and doesn't cause me any foot pain or aggravate my plantar fasciitis. I just wish the tread would last longer than 6 months (to be fair - I walk at least 10 miles a day in them).
customer_reviews.author: Paul J DeSimone

customer_reviews.title: I love Saucony sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony sneakers. I bought them once and have never looked back. Most comfortable sneakers that I've ever had. I used to suffer from shin splints but ever since wearing these that's not a problem anymore and I'm so thankful for that.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. The Black/Royal Grid Excursion TR10 size 10 lists GoreTex construction under the product description. This is inaccurate. The Excursion TR10 GTX will have a GoreTex tag on the outer side of the shoe as shown in picture. The pictures on Amazon do not have said tag and the shoe they ship is not made of GoreTex nor is it waterproof. They fit as expected and are quite comfortable. However, they are not as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth T.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With The Excursion.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the Saucony Excursion. I've used them since the TR8 series and they continue to fit, although this pair is running on the smaller side, and feel the same which is often not the case. I've tried other brands at four times the price but these outperform those.
customer_reviews.author: Doanld S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, very comfortable soles. I have walked several miles but only light jogging thus far. Very comfortable, wish I had other pairs for wearing to work and elsewhere. The red and black also just look good and it's not hard to keep it looking clean.
customer_reviews.author: JustinHoca

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty - 8 to 10 year of use
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, my last pair lasted 8-10 years even with regular use and occasional heavy duty use. After 10 years the shoes were still in great condition, they just started to smell funny, which is definitely not the shoes fault. I saw these on sale the other day and bought 3 more pairs, I expect these to last the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Bielawskijb

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Fit, Amazon Value
customer_reviews.text: I can literally order the same size of any Saucony model and the fit will be the same; ideal. The fact that these were on sale for $35 led me to buy two pair, and I was not disappointed. An inexpensive footwear option that feels great is always a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Peringer

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Shoes--Great!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find brand and variety in stores. Love the Saucony brand. Have a couple of pairs, so I just ordered the same size. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: bj389hc

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, but all I buy is Saucony so I wasn't expecting anything less....Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe, but the size 12 was too small for my feet and I had to return the shoes. If they offered a 12 1/2 size, I would have taken that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Slager

customer_reviews.title: Good for easy to moderate trail run
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using it on my trail race, good traction compare to regular shoes.
customer_reviews.author: TOP GUN

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: It is the best shoe I have ever gotten from Saucony. Great support, a neutral stance and long lasting comfort. My feet felt just as good at the end of the day as they did in the morning.I immediately bought another pair and then my wife wanted a pair of her own.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe. Lasts a long time and is comfortable. One of the best shoes I ever used.
customer_reviews.author: David Freydkin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Trail Running
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered several pairs of these shoes. They wear well, mitigate a lot of my running problems, and look good. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vantongeren

customer_reviews.title: For you hiking habit
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of Excursion TR. good lacing system. The laces really hold their place. Shoes breath well. Traction on dry dusty terrain is great and the tread is good for 300 miles on Camelback mountain in Phoenix. My only complaint is the tongue wants to fall to the side when wearing.
customer_reviews.author: steven voelkel

customer_reviews.title: Returned b/c not Gortex as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I returned these because the product description said they were gortex, when in fact they are not. Confirmed by Saucony and I informed Amazon to fix the product description. They need to say GTX In the model number to be Gortex.
customer_reviews.author: Giv

customer_reviews.title: COMFY
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy shoes and a great price. They should last me a year.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair and I love them. Great price and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Third pair that I have purchased for my husband. He puts a lot of "fast" walking miles on them and says they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S.

customer_reviews.title: I think for the better. My son complains they are to warm
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 15 year old son.They are the second pair he has had,I also wear them in the womans style.Some changes have been made to them, I think for the better.My son complains they are to warm.We use them to hike and run on dirt roads/trails.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but
customer_reviews.text: I normally love the shoes.The price is right, decent style, normally really comfortable, but for some reason this pair has an odd feeling in the heel area on the sides of the heel. It almost feels like there's a plastic molding going around your heel on the back and side of your foot. It might be just error at the factory so I'm gonna probably return the shoes for a replacement pair and hope that solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't even donate them they were so bad. This is not worth your money
customer_reviews.text: The shoes came and first of all I thought that they were water resistant because that is what they stated. They are not. They were definitely seconds because the seem was poking through the whole. They left a large blister on my foot. I threw them away after one week. I couldn't even donate them they were so bad. This is not worth your money. Buy them from a different seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cook

customer_reviews.title: but walker/joggers/hikers like me it's a great shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a well respected brand, too heavy for avid runners, but walker/joggers/hikers like me it's a great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa L. Marschik

customer_reviews.title: I bought my first pair of Saucony shoes at Shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of Saucony shoes at Shoe Carnival. I was impressed how light they were.So when I saw these at the price, I had to buy to have a backup pair. These have become my primary pair since they are newer. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Loctite purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Fit Good, Feel Good
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit, feel and the look of these shoes. They fit as I expected. Comfortable to wear and I like the look of these shoes. Will be used for walking rather than running.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Honey

customer_reviews.title: They squeak.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes make a lot of noise, even when walking on carpet. There is something in the construction that makes a squeaking noise with every step. I have been a brand loyal Saucony customer for a few years now and hope this is not a sign of deteriorating production quality. I hoped that this would get better with use, but after 3 1/2 weeks of regular wear, they are still just as loud.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Last pair lasted a year.
customer_reviews.text: This is the forth pair of saucony’s i have owned. I love them. I’ve tried other shoes but these really fit my running needs.
customer_reviews.author: TAE

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant as shoe size varies from manufacturer to manufacturer, but these fit perfect for a wide 13 foot! They are very comfortable, and I really like the color (Gray with red accents).
customer_reviews.author: Anthony V. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great trail runners!
customer_reviews.text: Giving these 5 stars even though they are a bit narrow...or maybe my feet are a bit wide? I will order a wide size next time.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Love this Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I use SuperFeet insert orthodics with all my shoes, so most are comfortable and correct, but this last two I got from Amazon has proved to go beyond! I really love this shoe. It is very stable. I am Old, so only walk in them, but so far they are standing up better and the ones they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tuckerman

customer_reviews.title: trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: product which is true to Quality and fit every time
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: They don't disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: I bought many of those over the years. They don't disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Buy-Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe..Go higher in the size.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 12. They were too small and I return them with no problems. I think they are just sized small. I'm not going to knock the shoe just because of that. The shoe overall looks great, made well, very nice. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Job Saucony!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!!! I am on my feet 10+ hours per day, 5 days a week. I have tried many styles and brands of shoes over the years looking for all day comfort. The TR10 fits the bill. Comfortable and stylish. I WILL order other colors in the future. Great job Saucony!!
customer_reviews.author: Pop-Pop!

customer_reviews.title: Well made shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these shoes for my everyday shoes for 5 months and they are comfortable and are well made. I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: it feels light
customer_reviews.text: It feels okay. although, it feels like theres not enough material. feels flimsy. I wonder how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Corey P.

customer_reviews.title: Feels comfortable. Using it as a work shoe doing construction
customer_reviews.text: Fit well. Feels comfortable. Using it as a work shoe doing construction. So far its been great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for the money!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these tennis shoes. Great quality and good support. Also quite stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Schwanke

customer_reviews.title: I love this line for the durability
customer_reviews.text: I love this line for the durability. I first stumbled across the TR7, than 8s, and (2) pairs of 9s. This should would have gotten a 5 star if i could find it in the wide.
customer_reviews.author: Lycan66

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are snugged than my last set. I prefer a wider size, but getting what I want in a shoe at a low price comes with compromise. I've worn Saconey before and these are excellent shoes.
customer_reviews.author: E. F. Kraski

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for Active People
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of these shoes I have gotten. I keep coming back to them because they fit well and don't wear out very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Diekman

customer_reviews.title: terrible shoe.
customer_reviews.text: terrible shoe. hurts my knees. hits all wrong . not comfortable. . looks nice. expected much better. bought two pairs and am giving both away . very disappointed. long time saucony customer. will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mike morris

customer_reviews.title: They feel great!
customer_reviews.text: They feel great! Would have gotten a second pair if it was on sale like this one was and in my size.
customer_reviews.author: $pence

customer_reviews.title: I normally have good experiances with Saucony TR series shoes
customer_reviews.text: I normally have good experiances with Saucony TR series shoes. I have worn them for more than 5 years. However I received either a defective pair or the quality has declined. Customer service is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toebox
customer_reviews.text: These gave me a neuroma on my left foot. They have a slightly more narrow toe box than previous TR Saucony shoes. I had the TR7 and TR8 with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: SarahVA

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Saucony are the most comfortable sneakers I've ever tried. My lady agrees. These don't give a lot of lateral support if you were to really trail run in them but for moderate stuff and just walking around they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Menaker

customer_reviews.title: With the purchase price I wasn't sure if I would even get a shoe that looked anything like the photo posted
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised. With the purchase price I wasn't sure if I would even get a shoe that looked anything like the photo posted. But it came in (very fast shipping) and fits like a glove. Feels great on my feet and has done fairly well on the trails so far. Next thing to see, is how long they hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J Bales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! You may want to order smaller size since they are wide.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C Southard

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for hubby who's on his feet a lot during the day. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing product especially with patient with diabetes. The sole is soft and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: sultani

customer_reviews.title: Fraying and falling apart- one month of normal use. Not a normal shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Three children, endless shoes purchases, have never had a pair fall apart in a month. Frayed on the side (as in about an inch of fray, completely obvious) and the glue on the front failed, leaving the lip of the shoe loose. Never in my life have I experienced such poor construction of a shoe. Really regret this purchase. We had photos but amazon would not let them post them.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: I have been wearing Saucony for decades now. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Saucony for decades now. The style and comfort will keep me wearing them for decades to come.
customer_reviews.author: RnkJM

customer_reviews.title: Good ole shoes
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy slip on and off. Good for running around on errand duty. Haven't used for actual sport running.
customer_reviews.author: space kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great shoe except for the shoe strings that won't stay tied
customer_reviews.author: joseph h walkup

customer_reviews.title: For me they are so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Once I found a shoe that fitted my feet I was and have been sold on them ever since. Normally I’ll buy 3 pair as the first that gd I at least know I’ve got two more pair in the cupboard waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: These are the best shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I have ever owned. I wish they could make dress shoes like this! They are Goretex, and perfect in the rain and sloppy conditions, plus they are completely breathable. They are sturdy enough for trails but light enough to feel like a sneaker rather than a heavy hiking boot. They are very well constructed, but I can see myself going through the them pretty quickly just because I wear them all the time. I am seriously considering buying a few more pairs so I will keep having them for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: JG in Palisades

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. I love this brand. Between the gym and working on my feet all day this brand makes the best functional athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Better than UA..
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Way better than the lousy pair of Under Armour they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, excellent fit
customer_reviews.text: More robust than a running shoe. I use for walking and have another pair of Saucony shoes for running. This brand always fits my feet better than any other
customer_reviews.author: djb59

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best shoes for trail running on the Market
customer_reviews.text: The Shoe fits perfectly. This is one of the best shoes for trail running on the Market.
customer_reviews.author: Anslem John

customer_reviews.title: Trail runner
customer_reviews.text: Another great shoe by Saucony, have not tried them out on the trail yet. If they are anything like the other trail runners from Saucony I'm sure I will love them
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fowler

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Grid Excursion Tr10 Men's Footwear
product_meta.description: Saucony Excursion TR10 GTX Trail Running Shoe Enjoy the trails or any challenging terrain that you will encounter Take your run to the trails in any weather condition with the all new Excursion TR10 GTX. The outsole provides excellent protection and the traction on rough terrain while the waterproof and breathable GORE-TEX upper hugs the foot to provide support throughout your run. Upper - Lightweight Knit Mesh/Gore-Tex The GORE-TEX membrane is an extremely thin layer of expanded polytetrafluoroethylene (ePTFE) placed on the interior lining. It has over 9 billion pores per square inch. It's these pores that give the GORE-TEX fabric its Waterproof yet breathable characteristics. A breathable mesh makes up the majority of the upper unit. It has an open construction, therefore allowing air to enter the shoe to make a well-ventilated environment for the foot. This durable material doesn't tear apart easily, so it has a long-lasting effect. Supporting this material composition, durable synthetic overlays are placed on top of the mesh and stitched onto the material, then connected directly to the lacing system. When the shoelaces are adjusted, they cause the upper unit to follow suit, giving the runner a customizable fit. On the interior a soft fabric lining gives the runner a comfortable and non-irritating in-shoe feel. It doesn't cause any pressure points or warm parts, so it prevents welts and blisters. Working alongside this feature, the plush tongue and collar help in securing the foot and keeping it in place. It also adds a bit of cushioning to keep the foot comfortable and supported whilst reducing chances of chafing and discomfort. Midsole - Heel Grid System/IMEVA The IMEVA or Injection Molded Ethylene vinyl acetate is a full-length midsole foam that delivers responsible cushioning to the runner at all times. It doesn't have a substantial weight, so the runner won't feel that the platform is dragging them down. It's responsive and durable, and it even offers shock
feature_bullets: Sporty trail runner in mixed mesh and synthetic featuring quilted stitching details at toe and heel
